Class dom.container.BaseContainer 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.BaseComponent
            |
            +----dom.container.BaseContainer
public class BaseContainer
extends BaseComponent
Root abstract class to represent the inter-DObject container-containable relation. This class is used by the 'container' side of the container-containable relation. It produces an appropriate BaseContainerFacet, that can be delivered to the BaseContainable, for the inter-DObject protocol to establish containment.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
BaseContainerFacet, BaseContainable, BaseContainableFacet, ComponentDObject
Source Code:
BaseContainer.java

Constructor Detail

BaseContainer

public BaseContainer(ComponentDObject owner,
                     java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
Constructor for a BaseContainer. The two params are: 1) the ComponentDObject that owns this functionality; 2) The unique identifier associated with this instance. The identifier is here so that the ComponentDObject owner can have multiple instances of this class, and have some way to disambiguate them, internal to the ComponentDObject (for example, one ComponentDObject might have several of these BaseContainer instances to manage several different kinds of containment semantics).
Parameters:
owner - the ComponentDObject that is to have the BaseContainer semantics
uniqueIdentifier - the String that uniquely identifies the particular instance of the BaseContainer *within the ComponentDObject*. That is, since this is code *internal* to the ComponentDObject owner, the owner must guarantee uniqueness only internally...it does not have to guarantee uniqueness externally. This is so that the ComponentDObject can do the appropriate message routing.
owner - the ComponentDObject owner of this this containment functionality
uniqueIdentifier - a String the owner can use to disambiguate multiple instance of the BaseContainer class. Can be null, if (e.g.) the ComponentDObject has only one instance of this class to work with.
Method Detail

asynchAdd

public void asynchAdd(BaseContainableFacet containable,
                      java.io.Serializable data)
Entry point method for adding a containable to this container. This is the method that should be called when a message is sent to the owner DObject from any containables that have been given our BaseContainerFacet. Only receivers of the BaseContainerFacet have the ability to send us this message.

The containable must also provide some 'magic' bits in the 'data' parameter. This parameter can be used by subclasses of this class to implement arbitrary TOS checking for containment. See the method 'checkAddRequest' in this class.

If the owner of this functionality is a host, then the reception of this message will result in the a direct call to 'doHostAdd', which does the real work of adding the given containable to our set of contained items

Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet we are being requested to add
data - the Serializable data that the containable is passing in to satisfy our TOS checks
See Also:
checkAddRequest, doHostAdd

sendClientAddRequest

protected void sendClientAddRequest(SessionViewID fromID,
                                    DObjectID id,
                                    java.io.Serializable data)
Method for client to send an 'add' request to the host instance of this BaseContainable.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where the originating client is located
id - the DObjectID of the containable to add
data - any/all data to use for TOS checking by the host

getClientAddClosure

protected Closure getClientAddClosure(SessionViewID fromID,
                                      DObjectID id,
                                      java.io.Serializable data)
Get the Closure for the client to send an 'add' message to the host instance of this BaseContainer. Subclasses may override this method and determine for themselves which message is sent from client to host on an add request.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where the initiating client is located
id - the DObjectID of the BaseContainable to add
data - any/all data to pass for TOS checking on the add
Returns:
Closure that represents the message for the client to send to the host

asynchAddReq

public void asynchAddReq(SessionViewID fromID,
                         DObjectID containableID,
                         java.io.Serializable data)
Message received by host (from client) to request an add. This msg is sent by clients, and should only be received by the host. If received by a client, it is *ignored* (may eventually have clients forward to the process where they think the host is, to deal with host location changes)
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where the add request initiated. If add not successful, this is used to report failure back to requesting client (only)
containable - the DObjectID of the containable to be added
data - arbitrary data that is provided with request. This can be used by the host to validate the containment request (i.e. tos).

doHostAdd

protected void doHostAdd(BaseContainableFacet containable,
                         java.io.Serializable data,
                         boolean updateClients) throws java.lang.Exception
Do the add on a host instance of BaseContainer. This method is called either directly (if the host gets a request directly to add a containable), or via the cAddReq message handler above (request comes from client to us). This method will either succeed, or throw an exception...there is no in between.
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet that will be added. This param is checked to validate that it is non-null. If null, a NullFacetException is thrown.
data - any Serializable data that was sent along with the request. This can be used for TOS checks, etc.
updateClients - a boolean indicating whether the code in this method should update its clients. This param is here so that it is possible for the host code to operate host-only (no clients are updated).
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if BaseContainableFacet turns out to be inaccessible, we refuse to do the add because TOS checks not passed.

doTheAdd

protected final void doTheAdd(BaseContainableFacet containable,
                              boolean updateClients) throws ContainerException
Actually do the add to this container locally. This can be called by both host and client code. Client code should be sure to specify 'false' for the updateClients parameter. This method does the actual add of the given containable to this container. It verifies that the id associated with the containable facet is not already present in container (throws ContainerException if id is already contained).
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet being added
updateClients - boolean indicating whether this add should result in client notification
Throws:
ContainerException - thrown if some problem doing add

sendAddSuccessResultToClients

protected void sendAddSuccessResultToClients(DObjectID containable)
Method to send a result message to clients. May only be sent from host. Sends closure with method name CLIENT_ADD_RESULT_METHOD_NAME to clients
Parameters:
containable - the DObjectID of the containable that the client must add

sendAddFailResultToClientAtView

protected void sendAddFailResultToClientAtView(DObjectID containable,
                                               SessionViewID toID,
                                               java.lang.Exception result)
Method to send a fail result message back to the originating client. May only be sent from host. The method 'getAddClosure' is called to get the closure to deliver back to the client. The Exception associated with the failure (result) is passed into the getAddClosure method...this method will determine what message is actually sent back to the originating client upon add failure.
Parameters:
containable - the DObjectID of the containable that failed to be admitted
toID - the SessionViewID where this message is directed (the view that originated the request)
result - the Exception that occurred during host add, to be returned to the client
See Also:
getAddClosure

getAddClosure

protected Closure getAddClosure(DObjectID containableID,
                                java.lang.Exception result)
Get the Closure that will be sent to our remote client instances. If the 'result' parameter is null, it means that the add is successful, if non-null the add was not successful.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable just added
result - the Exception result of the add. If null, add was successful

asynchHostAddResult

public void asynchHostAddResult(DObjectID containableID,
                                java.lang.Exception result)
Method called on client in response to Closure sent from BaseContainer host. Message is actually sent from host execution of sendAddSuccessResultToClients method above.
Parameters:
containableID - the id of the containable that the host has added (or not) and notified us about.
result - the Exception associated with the add described by this message. If null, means that add by host was successful. If non-null, describes the failure.

hostAddSuccessful

protected void hostAddSuccessful(DObjectID containableID)
Message handler on the client side. This is the handler for a message sent from the host to a client (us) when an add was successful. If we cannot find the facet to the BaseContainable that was added, we report the problem back to our host via the sendClientAddFailure method. If everything is OK, we simply update our local cache of the containment state.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable just added by the host

hostAddFailed

protected void hostAddFailed(DObjectID containableID,
                             java.lang.Exception result)
Message handler on client for dealing with message back from host that add attempt failed. This will be sent to us by our host if we initiated an add request, and the add attempt failed on the host for whatever reason.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable that was *not* added
result - the Exception that was generated as part of the add failure

sendClientAddFailure

protected void sendClientAddFailure(DObjectID containableID,
                                    java.lang.Exception e)
This method is called if the host successfully adds a containable, and then sends an add message to its clients...and one (or several) are unable to do the actual add themselves. In that case, (determined in the client's doTheAdd code), the client will call this method to notify the host instance about the failure.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID for the BaseContainable that we (client) are having trouble with
e - the Exception describing the client's problem

getClientAddFailureClosure

protected Closure getClientAddFailureClosure(DObjectID containableID,
                                             java.lang.Exception e)
Get the Closure that represents the message to our host, when a client fails to accomplish an add. This is called from within the sendClientAddFailure when a client, upon request of the host, cannot comply with the host's request to add a given containable to its set of contained items. This will result in the method corresponding to the string defined by CLIENT_ADD_FAILURE to be invoked on the host. The host must deal with this notification appropriately (typically by removing the containable).
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable that failed
e - the Exception generated on the client when the add was attempted
Returns:
Closure that represents the CLIENT_ADD_FAILURE message to the host

asynchClientAddFailure

public void asynchClientAddFailure(SessionViewID viewID,
                                   DObjectID containableID,
                                   java.lang.Exception e)
This is the message handler on the host invoked when a client reports that it was unable to accomplish an add request from us. By default, this code removes the given containable from us, so that their is no ambiguity about whether the containable is contained or not. This is critical such that we the host can maintain consistency of the containment state of all of our clients.
Parameters:
viewID - the SessionViewID of the view where the client failed to be added
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable that failed to be added
e - the Exception that occurred on the client

asynchRemove

public void asynchRemove(BaseContainableFacet containable)
Entry point method for removing a containable from this container. This is the method that should be called when a message is sent to the owner DObject from any containables that have been given our BaseContainerFacet. Only receivers of the BaseContainerFacet have the ability to send us this message.

If the owner of this functionality is a host, then the reception of this message will result in the a direct call to 'doHostRemove', which does the real work of removing the given containable from our set of contained items

Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet we are being requested to remove
See Also:
doHostRemove

sendClientRemoveRequest

protected void sendClientRemoveRequest(SessionViewID fromID,
                                       DObjectID id)
Method for client to send an 'remove' request to the host instance of this BaseContainable
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where the originating client is located
id - the DObjectID of the containable to remove

getClientRemoveClosure

protected Closure getClientRemoveClosure(SessionViewID fromID,
                                         DObjectID id)
Get the Closure for the client to send a 'remove' message to the host instance of this BaseContainer. Subclasses may override this method and determine for themselves which message is sent from client to host on a remove request.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where the initiating client is located
id - the DObjectID of the BaseContainable to add
Returns:
Closure that represents the message for the client to send to the host

asynchRemoveReq

public void asynchRemoveReq(SessionViewID fromID,
                            DObjectID containableID)
Message received by host (from client) to request a remove. This msg is sent by clients, and should only be received by the host. If received by a client, it is *ignored* (may eventually have clients forward to the process where they think the host is, to deal with host location changes)
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where the remove request initiated. If remove not successful, this is used to report failure back to requesting client (only)
containable - the DObjectID of the containable to be added

doHostRemove

protected void doHostRemove(BaseContainableFacet containable,
                            boolean updateClients) throws java.lang.Exception
Do the remove on a host instance of BaseContainer. This method is called either directly (if the host gets a request directly to remove a containable), or via the cRemoveReq message handler above (request comes from client to us). This method will either succeed, or throw an exception...there is no in between.
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet that will be added. This param is checked to validate that it is non-null. If null, a NullFacetException is thrown.
updateClients - a boolean indicating whether the code in this method should update its clients. This param is here so that it is possible for the host code to operate host-only (no clients are updated).
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if BaseContainableFacet turns out to be inaccessible

doTheRemove

protected final void doTheRemove(BaseContainableFacet containable,
                                 boolean updateClients) throws ContainerException
Actually do the remove from this container locally. This can be called by both host and client code. Client code should be sure to specify 'false' for the updateClients parameter. This method does the actual remove of the given containable from this container. It verifies that the id associated with the containable facet is already present in container (throws ContainerException if id is not already contained).
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet being remove
updateClients - boolean indicating whether this remove should result in client notification
Throws:
ContainerException - thrown if some problem doing remove

doHardRemove

protected final void doHardRemove(DObjectID containableID,
                                  boolean updateClients)
Actually do the remove from this container locally. This can be called by both host and client code. This cannot fail to remove the given DObjectID.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable being removed
updateClients - boolean indicating whether this remove should result in client notification

sendRemoveSuccessResultToClients

protected void sendRemoveSuccessResultToClients(DObjectID containable)
Method to send a result message to clients. May only be sent from host. Sends closure with method name CLIENT_REMOVE_RESULT_METHOD_NAME to clients
Parameters:
containable - the DObjectID of the containable that the client must remove

sendRemoveFailResultToClientAtView

protected void sendRemoveFailResultToClientAtView(DObjectID containable,
                                                  SessionViewID toID,
                                                  java.lang.Exception result)
Method to send a fail result message back to the originating client. May only be sent from host. The method 'getRemoveClosure' is called to get the closure to deliver back to the client. The Exception associated with the failure (result) is passed into the getRemoveClosure method...this method will determine what message is actually sent back to the originating client upon add failure.
Parameters:
containable - the DObjectID of the containable that failed to be removed
toID - the SessionViewID where this message is directed (the view that originated the request)
result - the Exception that occurred during host remove, to be returned to the client
See Also:
getRemoveClosure

getRemoveClosure

protected Closure getRemoveClosure(DObjectID containableID,
                                   java.lang.Exception result)
Get the Closure that will be sent to our remote client instances. If the 'result' parameter is null, it means that the remove was successful, if non-null the remove was not successful.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable just removed
result - the Exception result of the remove. If null, remove was successful

asynchHostRemoveResult

public void asynchHostRemoveResult(DObjectID containableID,
                                   java.lang.Exception result)
Method called on client in response to Closure sent from BaseContainer host. Message is actually sent from host execution of sendRemoveSuccessResultToClients method above.
Parameters:
containableID - the id of the containable that the host has removed (or not) and notified us about.
result - the Exception associated with the removed described by this message. If null, means that remove by host was successful. If non-null, describes the failure.

hostRemoveSuccessful

protected void hostRemoveSuccessful(DObjectID containableID)
Message handler on the client side. This is the handler for a message sent from the host to a client (us) when a remove was successful.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable just removed by the host

hostRemoveFailed

protected void hostRemoveFailed(DObjectID containableID,
                                java.lang.Exception result)
Message handler on client for dealing with message back from host that remove attempt failed. This will be sent to us by our host if we initiated a remove request, and the remove attempt failed on the host for whatever reason. Actually, this should never happen, and should never be sent to us by the host, but subclasses may wish to override this behavior, and have the opportunity to do so.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable that was *not* removed
result - the Exception that was generated as part of the remove failure

notifyBeforeAdd

protected void notifyBeforeAdd(BaseContainableFacet containable)
Method called by add routines that does notification *before* add has occurred. The parameter notify may be null.
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet that has been added to us. If null, nothing will be added to the notification vector.

notifyBeforeRemove

protected void notifyBeforeRemove(BaseContainableFacet containable)
Method called by remove routines that does notification *before* remove has occurred.
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet that has been removed from us.

notifyBeforeRemove

protected void notifyBeforeRemove(DObjectID containableID)
Method called by remove routines that does notification *before* remove has occurred.
Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID of the containable that has been removed from us.

Parameters:
containableID - the DObjectID that has been removed from us.

addToNotify

private void addToNotify(BaseContainableFacet notify)
Add given BaseContainableFacet to our notification vector.

removeFromNotify

private void removeFromNotify(DObjectID notifyID)
Remove given BaseContainableFacet element from our notification vector.
Parameters:
notifyID - the DObjectID of the BaseContainableFacet to remove.

checkAddRequest

protected boolean checkAddRequest(BaseContainableFacet containable,
                                  java.io.Serializable data)
Entry point method for TOS checks for adds to this container. This method is called doHostAdd method to do TOS check before adding given id with provided data.
Parameters:
containable - the BaseContainableFacet of the containable to putatively be added
data - any data that the id has sent along. If we require some specific information to approve containment, then it would be passed in this parameter. May be null.
Returns:
true if add is approved, false if rejected

getContainableFacetForID

protected BaseContainableFacet getContainableFacetForID(DObjectID id) throws NullFacetException
Utility method to get a particular type of DObjectFacet appropriate for this Component (i.e. BaseContainableFacet). Simply a wrapper for BaseComponent.getFacetForID + class cast.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID to find the facet for
Returns:
BaseContainableFacet corresponding to given id. Null if none exists
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if facet is bogus

showContents

protected java.lang.String showContents()

handleDObjectGone

public void handleDObjectGone(DObjectID id)
Handle the departure of the DObject identified by the id parameter. This is called for us by the ComponentDObject.notifyComponentsOfDeactivation, which is called in response to the departure of the DObject identified by the given DObjectID. In response to this, for the BaseContainer class, we assume that if we contain the given DObject, that we should *remove* it from our set of contained DObjects. If subclasses wish, they may override this behavior, and do something else in response to this message, BUT they cannot assume that any facets they might be holding onto that belong to this id are still valid.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the departing DObject
Overrides:
handleDObjectGone in class BaseComponent

createNewFacetForID

public DObjectFacet createNewFacetForID(DObjectID requestor,
                                        java.io.Serializable data)
Create a new instance of a facet for delivery to the DObject identified by the id parameter. This default implementation always returns null, which means that no facet is provided. Subclasses will want to override this to deliver facets to target DObjects as appropriate. The data parameter is present so that arbitrary data associated with the request can be passed into this method, so it can make the appropriate judgment about whether a facet should be provided.
Parameters:
requestor - the DObjectID of the requestor DObject
data - any Serializable data required
Overrides:
createNewFacetForID in class BaseComponent

checkFacetForCache

public boolean checkFacetForCache(DObjectFacet aFacet)
Check given facet for addition to our facet cache. This is called by the ComponentDObject.notifyComponentsOfFacet method. This method allows the code in this component to decide whether it is interested in caching the facet that has been provided to the owner DObject, potentially for later use. If this method returns true, then the facet is added to our cache via the addFacetToCache method. If false, the facet is ignored by this component. This implementation of this method always returns false, indicating that it is not interested in any facets. Subclasses can override this functionality as desired.
Parameters:
aFacet - the DObjectFacet that we are entitled to examine
Returns:
true if the given DObjectFacet should be cached, false otherwise
Overrides:
checkFacetForCache in class BaseComponent
